content: Use PowerShell to write a script that lists all services running on a Windows machine, along with their status and start type. The output should be sorted by service name. PLAINFORMAT

Sure, I can help you with that. Here's a PowerShell script that lists all services running on a Windows machine, including their status and start type, sorted by service name:

```powershell
Get-Service | Select-Object Name, Status, StartType | Sort-Object Name
```

Let me explain what this script does:

1. `Get-Service`: This cmdlet retrieves all services on the local computer.

2. `Select-Object Name, Status, StartType`: This selects only the Name, Status, and StartType properties of each service.

3. `Sort-Object Name`: This sorts the output by the service name in ascending order.

You can run this script in PowerShell to get the list of services sorted by name, showing their status and start type.

If you need any further customization or have any other questions, feel free to ask!
